summary: This is an internal email chain from September 2020 forwarding a Telegraph news article. The article reports that federal prosecutors from the Southern District of New York (SDNY) filed a letter requesting a stay in a civil lawsuit against Ghislaine Maxwell, arguing it would jeopardize the ongoing criminal case against her. The email includes an attachment of the government's filed letter.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The British heiress facing child sex trafficking charges. She is detained in a federal prison in Brooklyn, has pleaded not guilty, and is the subject of both a criminal prosecution and a civil lawsuit.

persons.name: Josie Ensor
persons.context: Author of the Telegraph article being forwarded in the email chain.

persons.name: Jane Doe
persons.context: A pseudonym for a woman, now 40, who filed a civil lawsuit against Ghislaine Maxwell. She alleges she was groomed and abused by Epstein and Maxwell starting at age 13 in 1994.

persons.name: Robert Glassman
persons.context: Lawyer representing Jane Doe in the civil suit. He wrote a letter to the court arguing against a stay, stating his client is best served by pressing forward with her claims.

persons.name: Virginia Roberts Giuffre
persons.context: A victim of Epstein's who filed a separate civil defamation case against Ghislaine Maxwell. A court in Manhattan is due to hear oral arguments on September 22, 2020, regarding unsealing evidence in her case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The late financier who Ghislaine Maxwell allegedly groomed minor girls for. His estate, worth an estimated $577 million, is being sued by a number of his victims.

connections.description: Maxwell allegedly groomed three minor girls to be abused by Epstein in the mid-1990s. The civil suit alleges Jane Doe was approached by both Epstein and Maxwell.
Jane Doe is the plaintiff in a civil lawsuit against Maxwell, alleging Maxwell groomed and facilitated her abuse by Epstein starting when she was 13.
Jane Doe alleges she was subjected to years of sexual abuse by Epstein after being groomed by him and Maxwell.
Robert Glassman is identified as the lawyer representing Jane Doe in her civil lawsuit against Ghislaine Maxwell.
Giuffre has filed a civil defamation case against Maxwell, with a hearing scheduled for September 22, 2020.

events.title: Telegraph Article on Prosecutors' Stay Request
events.description: The Telegraph publishes an article detailing that federal prosecutors (SDNY) have filed a letter requesting a halt to a civil lawsuit against Ghislaine Maxwell, arguing it jeopardizes the criminal case.

events.title: Scheduled Hearing in Giuffre Defamation Case
events.description: A court in Manhattan is due to hear oral arguments in the civil defamation case filed by Virginia Roberts Giuffre against Ghislaine Maxwell, regarding the unsealing of 'sensitive' evidence.

events.title: Alleged Grooming of Jane Doe Begins
events.description: Jane Doe alleges she was first approached at age 13 by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell at a summer camp in Michigan, beginning a months-long grooming process.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein Arrest
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested on multiple sex-trafficking charges.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his prison cell five weeks after his arrest.

locations: Brooklyn (federal prison where Ghislaine Maxwell is detained)
Michigan (summer camp where Jane Doe was allegedly first approached)
Manhattan (location of court hearing the Giuffre defamation case)
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction of the prosecutors)
keyFacts: Federal prosecutors from the SDNY argued that allowing a civil lawsuit against Ghislaine Maxwell to proceed would jeopardize the criminal case against her due to 'factual overlap' and risks exposing the investigation.

The civil suit, filed under the pseudonym Jane Doe, contains allegations substantially similar to the criminal indictment, including that Maxwell groomed three minor girls for abuse by Epstein in the mid-1990s.
Jane Doe alleges she was groomed starting at age 13 in 1994 after being approached by Epstein and Maxwell at a summer camp in Michigan, followed by years of sexual abuse.
The government's position for a stay in the civil case aligns them, in this instance, with Ghislaine Maxwell and the co-executors of Epstein's estate, who also want the case halted.
A separate hearing is scheduled for September 22, 2020, in the civil defamation case filed by Virginia Roberts Giuffre against Maxwell, concerning the unsealing of evidence.
